section.title: Timer Facility Configuration
section.para: The JAIN SLEE Timer Facility is the module responsible for managing SLEE timers, and the number of threads it uses is configurable.
The Timer Facility configuration can be changed through an XML file and a JMX MBean.

section.title: Timer Facility Persistent Configuration
section.para: Configuration is done through an XML descriptor for each &THIS.PLATFORM; Cluster. The XML file is named jboss-beans.xml and is located at {JBOSS_HOME}/server/{profile_name}/deploy/restcomm-slee/META-INF
The configuration is exposed a JBoss Microcontainer Bean:

table.title: JAIN SLEE Timer Facility Bean Configuration

row.entry: defines how many threads should be used by the Timer Facility

section.title: Timer Facility JMX Configuration
section.para: Through JMX the Timer Facility module configuration can be changed with the container running. Note that such configuration changes are not persisted.

The JMX MBean which can be used to change the Timer Facility configuration is named org.mobicents.slee:name=TimerFacilityConfiguration, and provides getters and setters to change each property defined in the persistent configuration. The JMX Console can be used to use this MBean, see .
